I have been playing this game for over 3 years and a i can assure you there is nothing more stressing to experience everytime you play! 
I have reached red ranks as killer and i have a lot of experience in the game so i know what im talking about!
The map design of this game is terrrible bad designed, where the 4 survivors are always in constant advantage in any point of the game, as a killer you depend on them to do mistakes so you can actually win! There is only one exception but you would be forced to play "the nurse" everytime you want to play killer letting the other 21 one killers completly useless, the maps are extremly big making so that a killer is in constant stress and forces him to be everywhere anywhere which is quite literally impossible! There are around 15 pallets in which map that are MOSTLY safe, not to count infinite loops and window vaults, the meta has no variaty, as the survivors can win the game with builds full of second chances perks, making the killer pressure nule! If the survivors are coordenated and skillfull they can win the game in under 4 minutes, and the killer HAS NO WAY TO PREVENT THIS except if you are using the nurse! I would not recommend you to touch on this game if you are planning to try out to play killer! It will stress you and make you mad every time you try to play and climb! The part of the community that only plays survivors is extremly toxic and will make sure to make fun of you and make your experience even worse! 
This game should have a look at their map design and remove unfun mecanics from both survivor and killer side, implement more teamwork and wipeout a little of the community, 80% of the maps are survivor favored they should rework second chance perks, remove Bloodlust from killers and buff each singular individual to have a fighting chance and make all of them a little more competitive to use compared to the top tiers.
In a game where the killer is supposed to be the strong unit and make the game challanging to the other team is ALWAYS THE UNDERDOG the game is never in their favor if survivors do mistakes, even in the emblem system where you are scored from how many hooks you make and not how many kills/sacrifices, the "Gatekeeper" emblem makes no sense since killers have very low/none chances to slow them down if the survivors are split up, since it's release the game has been in a unhealthy state, from a community aspect to a game balance aspect and i would not recomend to buy it if you want to have fun playing games

10 Загрузок за маньяка из 10 ( ни одного)

* Bad balancing
* Devs are greedy AF pushing one DLC after another while it took them more than 5 years into release to re-think their ranking system.
* Extreme grind fest. The more DLC's you buy the harder you have to grind through dozens of junk teachable before you get the ones you need. Thus making buying more characters actually punishing for you to the point where you have to grind for weeks just to play that new killer in the way you want to. And most killers do not come with perks that are any helpful, so you have to make the grind if you want to win matches.
* DLC's go for 5-7€ each but if you don't want to play the standard skin you have to pay an additional 10€ for a single skin!
* Game is designed to be balanced at low ranks. These Devs have a very close look on how steam reviews work. The majority of people buy a game, leave a review after a few hours and then move on. This is where 100% of the services go. Play for a little bit longer and you will see the piles of dirt under the carpet. 
* Killers are presented as cruel monsters survivors are afraid of. The reality is a very different one. As a Killer this game stays and falls with how good you perform. As a Killer, it is 100% YOUR Job to put pressure on them. But this also means that 100% of the pressure is on you while you are dealing with 4 others.

As a survivor: You mess up a loop and get hooked?
No problem. The others come save you and you have another 2 shots.
As a Killer: Mess up against a good group and Hunt a survivor for 30 seconds too long?
Congratulations. You have basically lost the match, you will see all gens pop around you and survivors will run for the exit. Good luck to get one so they may or may not decide to win the match or stay a little longer by their own will trying to save the last of them.
There is no room for mistakes and 100% of the pressure is on you.

And trust me, they will let you know when you did a "bad" job!
# You can not catch them? = Baby Killer!
# You catch one while the game is almost over and then stay near the hook to get another one?
Fucking face camper idiot!
# You did actually a very good Job playing fair and square and still made a 4K?
Complete silence.

You can spin the table as long as you want. You are everyone's bitch and just the enabler so others can have their fun with you. No recommendation and only somewhat enjoyable with a extremely high tolerance against frustration. Especially if you play for more then a couple of hours this game will shred your nerves into pieces and there is no one who cares. As i said. All the services go into new DLC's, cosmetics, and low-rank balancing. Printing money and getting good reviews. A dream for every developer. And fuck these no-life long term players. They are milked dry anyway.

Please take my advice do not get this game, this game will make you hate it but you will be unable to stop playing. You will be in a downwards spiral of playing this game and hating over 50% of the time played, overall a good game to get if you want to punish yourself, or as a gift for that special someone you hate. But here's a short list of problems I have with the game.

Also I can't forget about the fact that the devs just straight up ignore any feedback on upcoming content until it's in the live and it becomes a problem. It has happened for at least 2 updates in a row. So if you want devs that ignore feedback just go on and get dead by daylight, if you actually want devs that listen to feedback do as the devs say and "just play Civilization instead"

Been playing this game since pretty much day 1. The amount of support and dedication from the devs, even after 4 years for this initially indie game, is beyond me. Playing as either Killer or Survivor ranges from stressful to enjoyable to wait-simulator to intense. I love this game an will gladly support them for as long as they keep putting out new and unique Killers/perks.
